intro: Phoebe chavarriana, commonly known as the Chavarria phoebe, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and cinnamon trees. The plant is characterized by its fragrant, small white flowers and glossy, evergreen leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
